13. Next to flesh color, this gold-yellow
signifies moderate wealth: by itself, at times,
it indicates a rational man, of good quality,
of a moderate and wise demeanor,
also of good counsel, and everywhere at ease.
But among all pure precious stones,
it is Topaz (to be precise) to which
this noblest gold color is most compared.

14. Yellow is thus a beautiful and joyful color,
bright, and clear in aspect as it approaches white.
During the times of both Moses and Solomon,
there was a veil, or a great curtain,
artfully made and wrought of silk,
but yellow was the principal color.
So it does not seem contrary to propriety
To present yellow as the first of the colors.

15. While the ancient Painters only had four sorts
of colors, as we have said earlier,
yellow was one of them.
Without it, what would they have invented
To give their work any appearance?
However, we already have four different kinds
Of yellow, aside from Ocher:
Masticot, brown-yellow, and two Orpiments.

16. Minium can also serve sufficiently
as orange-yellow, that is, the color of gold;
one can use it with Masticot
to create decoration. For it is ridiculous
to use a great deal of Gold, one must shun it
in one’s work. I have no power to forbid it entirely,
but it is better to agree
to produce decoration with colors.

left-middleTo decorate with Gold is despised by certain writers; yet that which looks good, is good. Art is to adorn well and with moderation, and it does not matter what means are used for a good look

17. While in earlier times some believed
that their work with Gold to be beautiful–
which was highly praised by those who lacked intelligence –
in these times it would be considered disfiguring
rather than an embellishment.
Thus wishing to depict Dido
leaving the hunt with Aeneas of Troy,
one would not need to be very generous with Gold.
